org.wildfly.swarm.spi.api

Interface Fraction<T extends Fraction>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BeanValidationFraction, CamelFraction, CDIConfigFraction, CDIFraction, ConnectorFraction, DatasourcesFraction, EEFraction, EJBFraction, HystrixFraction, InfinispanFraction, IOFraction, JAXRSFraction, JCAFraction, JGroupsFraction, JMXFraction, JPAFraction, JSFFraction, KeycloakFraction, LoggingFraction, MailFraction, ManagementFraction, MessagingFraction, MonitorFraction, MSCFraction, NamingFraction, OpenTracingFraction, RemotingFraction, RequestControllerFraction, ResourceAdapterFraction, RibbonFraction, RibbonSecuredClientFraction, SecurityFraction, TopologyFraction, TopologyWebAppFraction, TransactionsFraction, UndertowFraction, WebServicesFraction

    public interface Fraction<T extends Fraction>
    Root of a tree of configuration for a particular subset of functionality.

    While each portion of functionality is called a "fraction", this class maps to the configuration there-of. It should be implemented to include whatever configuration is appropriate for the subset of functionality.

    In the event a logical "fraction" requires no configuration, a subclass of this class is not required.

    For functionality coming in through WildFly, the implementation is a sub-class of the matching WildFly subsystem configuration tree from the wildfly-config-api project.

    Author:
    Bob McWhirter

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default T applyDefaults()
      Apply whatever defaults are required if this fraction was not explicitly configured by a user.
      default T applyDefaults(boolean hasConfiguration)
